result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett Michael Berger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Payment plan $100 per paycheck (biweekly)  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.
  The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.
No Contact with B.O. or F.S.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
Written apology to victim within 30 days of sentencing provided to Probation Agent.

timeConds.notes: Community service is to be done at the rate of no less than 10 hrs per month. Written verification must be provided to the Probation Agent and the Clerk of Courts. Verificiation must be provided on letterhead of the nonprofit agency for which service was performed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brett Michael Berger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from def to ct on payments
to ct from def on payments

Defendant Brett Michael Berger in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Ct check to see if def has been making payments, def has made. PO is Kevin Seefeldt, say him 4/22 doesnt have any other appointments. Has not gone to the jail to get DNA taken, Ordered to go to the Jail after this hearing to get DNA done. Has gone to meeting, done community service. Ct  advises some thing still need to be done. ADA will follow up to see

Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Ruth Kressel plea to counts 2 and 3, bail jumping amended to misd recomment WH sent 18 mo probation, REST. A Mitchell $875 JS NC with Bradley Odum of F.S., cogn. thinking, other counceling,DNA spec, $10 fine and costs in each count, 189 hrs CS at least 10hrs per month, written verification to DOC and COC on letterhead, written apology within 30 days, expunction.  Parties agree 15CF209  Ct2 PTAC theft and Ct3 PTAC criminal damage 16CF7 charge amended to misd bail jump 946.49(1)(b)-Plea Guilty. Admits reponsible for rest. Ct1 in 15CF209 DRI.  Ct accepts def plea and finds him Guilty. State has complied with victim right, statement filed.  Sent WH prob 18mo, report DOC 24hrs, JS liable for Rest $875, NC with Bradley Odum, NC with F.S., cogn thinking, other counceling, DNA spec, $10 fine on 488.88 bj, $499.38 on others, 180 hrs CS at least 10hrs per month, written verification to Agent and COC, written apology w/in 30 days (to Agent), expunction if completed. Income assignment $100 per paycheck Daily Press. Pay to COC. Probation Rev Hearing 5/18 3pm  Probation review hearing scheduled for May 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney John Charles Bachman appeared by phone means for Defendant Brett Michael Berger. Prosecuting Atty Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brett Michael Berger in court.  Parties have agreemt.  Plea 3 misd's.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 12:50 pm.

Defendant Brett Michael Berger in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rec'd copy each compl; waives read.  Waives t l for ph - given t l rts.  Agreemt to plea to 3 misd's.  Ct sched stc, but may be pleas.  DAP, bond cont's.  Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 12:00 pm.

Defendant Brett Michael Berger in court.  R Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Will be getting atty fr SPD office, ct adj's.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 12:30 pm.

Defendant Brett Michael Berger in court with attorney Kenneth R. Kratz (phone).  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Client is req'ing sub of atty & grant'd in bth cases.  Mo for Kratz to w/draw is grant'd.  Commits for unpd financial & did not go to booking as prev ordered by ct.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 08:15 am.
